string: ACT I
SCENE I. London. KING RICHARD II's palace.
Enter KING RICHARD II, JOHN OF GAUNT, with other Nobles and Attendants

string: Enter HENRY BOLINGBROKE and THOMAS MOWBRAY

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: THOMAS MOWBRAY
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: KING RICHARD II
speaker: KING RICHARD II

speaker: KING RICHARD II

speaker: KING RICHARD II

speaker: KING RICHARD II

speaker: KING RICHARD II

string: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: First, heaven be the record to my speech!
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: In the devotion of a subject's love,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Tendering the precious safety of my prince,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: And free from other misbegotten hate,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Come I appellant to this princely presence.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Now, Thomas Mowbray, do I turn to thee,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: And mark my greeting well; for what I speak
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: My body shall make good upon this earth,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Or my divine soul answer it in heaven.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Thou art a traitor and a miscreant,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Too good to be so and too bad to live,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Since the more fair and crystal is the sky,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: The uglier seem the clouds that in it fly.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Once more, the more to aggravate the note,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: With a foul traitor's name stuff I thy throat;
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: And wish, so please my sovereign, ere I move,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: What my tongue speaks my right drawn sword may prove.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: THOMAS MOWBRAY
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: Let not my cold words here accuse my zeal:
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: 'Tis not the trial of a woman's war,

string: Can arbitrate this cause betwixt us twain;
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: The blood is hot that must be cool'd for this:
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: As to be hush'd and nought at all to say:
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: From giving reins and spurs to my free speech;
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: Which else would post until it had return'd
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: These terms of treason doubled down his throat.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: Setting aside his high blood's royalty,

string: And let him be no kinsman to my liege,
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: I do defy him, and I spit at him;
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: Call him a slanderous coward and a villain:
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: Which to maintain I would allow him odds,
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: And meet him, were I tied to run afoot

speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: Where ever Englishman durst set his foot.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: Mean time let this defend my loyalty,
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: By all my hopes, most falsely doth he lie.
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Pale trembling coward, there I throw my gage,

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: And lay aside my high blood's royalty,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Which fear, not reverence, makes thee to except.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: If guilty dread have left thee so much strength

string: As to take up mine honour's pawn, then stoop:
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: What I have spoke, or thou canst worse devise.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: THOMAS MOWBRAY
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: Or chivalrous design of knightly trial:

speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: If I be traitor or unjustly fight!
speaker: THOMAS MOWBRAY

string: KING RICHARD II
speaker: KING RICHARD II

string: What doth our cousin lay to Mowbray's charge?
speaker: KING RICHARD II

speaker: KING RICHARD II

string: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: In name of lendings for your highness' soldiers,

string: Like a false traitor and injurious villain.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Or here or elsewhere to the furthest verge

string: That ever was survey'd by English eye,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Complotted and contrived in this land
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Fetch from false Mowbray their first head and spring.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Further I say and further will maintain

string: Upon his bad life to make all this good,

string: This arm shall do it, or this life be spent.

string: KING RICHARD II
speaker: KING RICHARD II

string: Two of the dangerous consorted traitors
speaker: LORD FITZWATER

string: That sought at Oxford thy dire overthrow.
speaker: LORD FITZWATER

string: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Thy pains, Fitzwater, shall not be forgot;
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Right noble is thy merit, well I wot.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Enter HENRY PERCY, and the BISHOP OF CARLISLE
HENRY PERCY
speaker: HENRY PERCY

string: The grand conspirator, Abbot of Westminster,
speaker: HENRY PERCY

string: With clog of conscience and sour melancholy
speaker: HENRY PERCY

string: Hath yielded up his body to the grave;
speaker: HENRY PERCY

string: But here is Carlisle living, to abide
speaker: HENRY PERCY

string: Thy kingly doom and sentence of his pride.
speaker: HENRY PERCY

string: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Carlisle, this is your doom:
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Choose out some secret place, some reverend room,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: More than thou hast, and with it joy thy life;
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: So as thou livest in peace, die free from strife:
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: For though mine enemy thou hast ever been,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: High sparks of honour in thee have I seen.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Enter EXTON, with persons bearing a coffin
EXTON
speaker: EXTON

string: Great king, within this coffin I present
speaker: EXTON

string: Thy buried fear: herein all breathless lies
speaker: EXTON

string: The mightiest of thy greatest enemies,
speaker: EXTON

string: Richard of Bordeaux, by me hither brought.
speaker: EXTON

string: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Exton, I thank thee not; for thou hast wrought
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: A deed of slander with thy fatal hand
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Upon my head and all this famous land.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: EXTON
speaker: EXTON

string: From your own mouth, my lord, did I this deed.
speaker: EXTON

string: HENRY BOLINGBROKE
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: They love not poison that do poison need,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Nor do I thee: though I did wish him dead,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: I hate the murderer, love him murdered.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: The guilt of conscience take thou for thy labour,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: But neither my good word nor princely favour:
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: With Cain go wander through shades of night,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: And never show thy head by day nor light.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Lords, I protest, my soul is full of woe,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: That blood should sprinkle me to make me grow:
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Come, mourn with me for that I do lament,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: And put on sullen black incontinent:
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: I'll make a voyage to the Holy Land,
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: To wash this blood off from my guilty hand:
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: March sadly after; grace my mournings here;
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: In weeping after this untimely bier.
speaker: HENRY BOLINGBROKE

string: Exeunt
